text: hi i'm vanessa from speak english with
vanessa calm who do you get along with
let's talk about it the expression that
we're going to talk about today is get
along with to get along with someone in
english we have a lot of expressions
that use the word get and today's
expression is one of those this
expression simply means who is your
friend who do you have a lot in common
with who do you enjoy spending time with
who do you get along with let's talk
about how to use this expression in the
positive negative and also the question
form in a positive form we could say I
get along with my husband I get along
with my sister I get along with my
co-workers who do you get along with
these are the people you enjoy spending
time with let's talk about the negative
form you might say I don't get along
with him I don't get along with my boss
maybe you have some problems there's
some tension or stress I don't get along
with him in the question form you might
ask who do you get along with who do you
get along with or you could ask do you
guys get along do you get along
this could mean you and your friend you
and your brother you and your coworker
do you get along this is the plural
version of you sometimes people might
say do you guys get along do you all get
along do you both get along but we could
simply say oh do you get along this
might be you with someone else and now I
want you to be able to use this
expression it's great to learn it but
you need to exercise your speaking
muscles and actually use it so if you
are not already on my website click the
link below this video and I want you to
answer this sample question
my question is who do you get along with
